sub_title: Global Speaker | Philosopher | Author | Faculty Member Nyenrode University | Member  Executive Committee and Chair Global Ethical Charter at Beyond Bretton Woods
summary:
Welcome! I'm Ruud Veltenaar - Global (TED) Speaker, philosopher, author of best seller Once Upon A Future, SDG-ambassador and Faculty Member (SLP) Nyenrode Business University.

With almost 30 years of experience as a thought leader, international serial entrepreneur, educator and impact investor I help people and organizations to create a better,  more sustainable world and just, inclusive society.

As a world leading future thinker I facilitate inspirements (keynotes, lectures, master classes, workshops, summer summits and board room interventions) on all continents about our world in transformation to the next phase in our civilization and the vital solutions for tomorrow's world.

What's gonna be: Rest? Retreat? Revolt? Or Reset through reimagination and redesign?

The past decades more than 1 million people from all over the world visited my inspirements about transformational leadership, innovative entrepreneurship, sustainability and living and working with impact.

My motto: In the end everything will be OK, and if it is not OK, it's not the end.

Good People, Doing Good.

position_groups:
[{'company': {'id': None, 'name': 'Beyond Bretton Woods', 'logo': None, 'url': None, 'employees': {'start': None, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2022}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Planet Earth', 'date': {'start': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2022}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'company': 'Beyond Bretton Woods', 'description': 'The Beyond Bretton Woods initiative proposes to create a multi-disciplinary international taskforce to design transformative, plug-and-play type vital solutions and disruptive policy recommendations to address both structural finance fault lines as well as crisis challenges affecting the international monetary order and society at large.

Beyond Bretton Woods triggers a radical paradigm shift in the purpose, principles and practices that underpin the systems and institutions that collectively make up the international financial architecture. The initiative attempts to deliver outcomes which best serve the interests of humanity and nature, ensuring inclusive and equitable outcomes, as well as quality of life for all.

The Global Ethical Charter will introduce a new code of values which will guide the role of the financial system as facilitator of evolution within society. What are the foundational beliefs and values? What should be the ethical underpinning of a monetary framework? What does it mean to be fair and just, and how can this be transcribed into the financial systems and architectures? A new system should reflect the concepts of justice, fairness, balance, ethics, premised on a common understanding of those concepts. The current Bretton Woods framework is deficient in its failure to give deference to these values. The deliverable is an ethical charter to be released by the United Nations.', 'title': 'Member Executive Committee and Chair Global Ethical Charter at Beyond Bretton Woods', 'employment_type': 'Part-time'}]}, {'company': {'id': 68227520, 'name': 'Speakers for Good', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C4E0BAQHSdaTAoFW7jw/company-logo_400_400/0/1593609164796?e=1700092800&v=beta&t=_w-3YHTW-EgI9XAUZdzn5f3aHCzE9lW_p8OZxrEK8jY', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/speakers-for-good/', 'employees': {'start': 2, 'end': 10}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Amsterdam, Noord-Holland, Nederland', 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'company': 'Speakers for Good', 'description': "Speakers for Good is a unique, purpose driven, boutique speakers agency for one planet and everything that lives on it, including 8 billion people. With compelling insights and a global perspective. With my work I offer clarity about the future and hope for a better world. I am future thinker and progressor who translates vague views into concrete actions in the here and now. With this I stimulate people and organizations to become more aware of their many challenges. To succeed in this, managers require sustainability strategies that are workable, tangible and easy to communicate. For decades, sustainability strategies have focused on managing and reducing existing environmental and social impacts, while communicating costs and reputational benefits to relevant stakeholders.

My contributions were organized around four main parts; a) foundation building of global responsibility, b) observations of symptoms and real challenges, c) Sense-making and reflecting of experiences and d) creating new ideas and solutions for a better world and more sustainable and social business', 'title': 'Visiting Lecturer (no permanent appointment)', 'employment_type': 'Contract'}]}, {'company': {'id': None, 'name': 'INTERNATIONAL SCHOOLS OF BUSINESS MANAGEMENT', 'logo': None, 'url': None, 'employees': {'start': None, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 3, 'day': None, 'year': 2017}, 'end': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Barcelona (2017) & London (2019)', 'date': {'start': {'month': 3, 'day': None, 'year': 2017}, 'end': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}}, 'company': 'INTERNATIONAL SCHOOLS OF BUSINESS MANAGEMENT', 'description': 'The Institute International Schools of Business Management is a small academy, facilitating programs and lectures for professors and lecturers of business schools and universities in Europe and Asia.
Examples of members and participants are: IMD, INSEAD, China Europe International Business School, London Business School (program leader in 2019), Manchester Business School, HEC Paris, Stockholm School of Economics, SDA Bocconi, IAE Aix-Marseille Graduate School of Management (program leader in 2017), IBO Business School and several other business schools Europa and Asia.

The ITP programmes bring together professors and business educators from around the world to share knowledge and develop the skills and capabilities they need to be successful in their careers. The ITP was founded by Harvard Business School in 1958 when, with financial backing from the Ford Foundation, a coordinated programme was set up to help train foreign faculties in the most effective learning and teaching processes.

Today the ITP is the leading management faculty development programme in the world. This flagship initiative has been going from strength-to-strength for more than 50 years with a consistent aspiration to develop faculties, share expertise and improve the quality of teaching across the world.

One of the long-established principles behind the success of the ITP has been a policy of rotation between the ISBM members. The ITP is managed by one of the ISBM schools for a period of two years, which ensures a continuous update of the programme’s content and ongoing cultural enrichment for its participants.', 'title': 'Visiting professor (no permanent appointment)', 'employment_type': 'Contract'}]}]
